title: 107_s1134
content: The Act may be cited as the "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" and includes modifications applicable to qualified small business stock. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" includes amendments such as the repeal of minimum tax preference, an increase in the rollover period for qualified small business stock from 60 days to 180 days, and a reduction in the holding period for gains from certain small business stock from 5 years to 3 years. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" includes amendments such as reducing the holding period for gains from certain small business stock from 5 years to 3 years, repealing the per-issuer limitation, amending the definition of qualified trade or business, and making other modifications to working capital and redemption rules. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" includes amendments like reducing the holding period for gains from small business stock to 3 years, increasing the exclusion to 100 percent, and waiving redemption rules for purchases with a business purpose. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" includes amendments such as increasing the exclusion to 100 percent for gains from small business stock and making various conforming amendments to the tax code. The "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001" increases the exclusion to 100 percent for gains from small business stock. Section 1202 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to exclude stock held among members of a controlled group. The exclusion for gains from small business stock is increased to 100 percent under the "Venture Capital Gains and Growth Act of 2001." Section 1202 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to exclude stock held within a controlled group based on specific asset limitations. The cost-of-living adjustment for taxable year amounts is determined by multiplying the dollar amount by the adjustment for the calendar year. Any adjusted amount not a multiple of $10,000 will be rounded to the nearest multiple. These amendments apply to stock issued after the enactment date of the Act.
